required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of Emergency Department Visits According to Incidence of Covid-19
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Emergency Department Visits According to Incidence of Covid-19 in French Metropolis : a One-year Multicenter Observationnal Retrospective Study.

brief_summary.textblock: With lockdown, Emergency Departments (ED) visits decrease, principally for visits unrelated with Covid-19. In our sutdy, we aimed to find a correlation between ED visits and incidence rate of Covid-19 in a French metropolis.

detailed_description.textblock:
All patients older than 18 years were included in 9 ED during 51 weeks. Patients transferred between the centers participating in the study were excluded
We count the number of visits per weeks, then the number of visits according to :
- reason for consultation Covid-like (cought, fever or dyspnea),
- reason for consultation with accodance to SFMU (French Emergency Medicine Society) reference
- diagnosis with accordance to SFMU reference
- orientation (home, medical unit, chirurgical unit, intensive care unit, psychiatric unit, death)
Pearson's correlation test compare incidence rat per week with this counts and admision rate.

primary_outcome.description: Count of non-Covid-19 visit per week

secondary_outcome.description: Count of each reason for visits category according to SFMU reference
Count of each diagnostic category according to SFMU reference
Count of each orientation (home, medical unit, chirurgical unit, intensive care unit, death, psychiatric unit, other)

other_outcome.description: Incidente rate of Covid 19 per week

study_pop.textblock: All patients visited one of 9 emergency department.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 and olders
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient who are tranferred between centers participating to the study.
